overview:
Joseph Dwyer is an Internet entrepreneur with 14 years of experience creating high-growth technology companies. His past ventures include: CEO and founder of The Virtual Market, one of the first dynamically generated e-commerce sites; CEO and founder of Blir, a 90-person technology consulting and custom software development company serving clients such as Bain & Company, Albertsons, and Exodus Computing; CTO and board member of LoanSurfer.com, a venture-backed online home mortgage company; and President and Founder of TouchPoint Solutions, an enterprise Software-as-a-Service company with customers including Kodak, British Petroleum, and Lockheed Martin. Joseph is an expert in web software design and development, including the architecture of a web-based device management and content distribution software system licensed by Kodak for $12 million for use on its worldwide network of 70,000 kiosks.

Joseph has a Masters in Business Administration with Distinction from the Kellogg School of management and a law degree Cum Laude from the Northwestern University School of Law, where he was awarded the Order of the Coif. Joseph also has an undergraduate degree in International Relations from the Georgetown University School of Foreign Service.
